meanings.definition: To take advantage of someone's generosity without giving anything in return.
meanings.sent1: Some people try to freeload off their friends by always asking for favors but never helping out.
meanings.sent2: It's not fair to freeload off your parents by living at home without contributing to the household.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to freeload off the bird feeder, taking all the seeds without sharing with the birds.
meanings.sent4: Don't be a burden and freeload off others; it's important to be self-sufficient.
meanings.sent5: She would often freeload off her coworkers, taking credit for their ideas without doing any work herself.

meanings.definition: A person who habitually depends on others for support or favors.
meanings.sent1: He was known as the office freeloader, always asking for help but never offering assistance to anyone else.
meanings.sent2: The freeloader at the party ate all the snacks without bringing anything to share.
meanings.sent3: The cat was a freeloader, always expecting to be fed but never catching any mice.
meanings.sent4: Being a freeloader may seem easy, but it can strain relationships and lead to resentment.
meanings.sent5: The freeloader in the group project never contributed any work but still expected to get a good grade.
